statement.tex: %text Write the value of $p$ for which $\ora{a}=\vector{3}{2}{9}$ and $\ora{b}=\vector{1}{p}{3}$ are parallel vectors. %

step.context: %text What does the condition $\ora{a}=\lambda\ora{b}$, for some scalar $\lambda$, signify? %
step.reason: %text Two parallel vectors share the same unit vector (direction), they only differ only in magnitude. Therefore, if $\hat a$ and $\hat b$ are unit vectors for $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$ respectively then, $\hat{a}=\hat{b}$. %

step.context: %text If $\ora{a}=\vector{3}{2}{9}$ and $\ora{b}=\vector{1}{p}{3}$ and $\ora{a}=\lambda\ora{b}$ what is p? %
